Posts.Content: May 3, 2008 03:26AM mooocows wrote: Miss JoAnn:  Just a thought for you, why not have your doctor order an ultrasound if needed and then you get results on the spot.  I live in Missouri and have had the same problem you have described - think all is fine, get a call, have to wait and wait before I can actually get results.  Now, my doctor sends an order to the imaging facility that reads "ultrasound if needed" and it always is.  They do the mammogram and then come and get me for the ultrasound.  I always see the radiologist before I leave.   It has really helped me to have peace of mind.  Good luck - Carolyn
